item.title: OCC to create fintech office
item.description: US regulator will appoint chief financial technology officer to lead regulation of sector

item.title: Hsu says US needs proper regulation of bank-fintech alliances
item.description: Policy-makers focus too much on crypto, says comptroller

item.title: Haitian banks suspend operations
item.description: Banks close as Caribbean country is rocked by fuel protests and inflation hits 10-year high

item.title: Philippine central bank raises capital requirements for rural banks
item.description: Rural banks’ association says the measure could hurt banks in low-income areas

item.title: China and Hong Kong to strengthen capital market ties, senior official says
item.description: Hong Kong markets should be able to trade in Chinese government debt futures, says Fang Xinghai

item.title: Tensions flare between policy-makers over US Treasury reform
item.description: SEC’s proposed rule-changes have “ruffled feathers” at Treasury department

item.title: Quiet man: is Michael Barr the Clark Kent of regulation?
item.description: A decade after crafting Dodd-Frank, Fed’s new vice-chair must tame DC's warring regulatory factions

item.title: Ecuador government will not recognise new superintendent of banks
item.description: Legislature and government clash as courts disagree on legality of appointment process

item.title: Fed announces new guidelines after master account controversy
item.description: Rules will impose tight scrutiny on non-conventional applicants

item.title: Activity-based regulation will not guarantee level playing field – BIS paper
item.description: Authors propose framework to clarify use of entity- and activity-based regulations

item.title: MAS to consult public on regulating stablecoins
item.description: Chairman says central bank will consider reserve requirements for stablecoin issuers

item.title: Endlessly interim? The struggle to appoint top US regulators
item.description: Two-year OCC vacancy is not that unusual in US system, but it may hamper initiative

item.title: Two US regulators fine Bank of America $225m
item.description: Country’s second-largest bank unlawfully blocked access to unemployment benefits

item.title: BoE’s Saporta floats idea of countercyclical liquidity buffer
item.description: Design of Basel III rules may be causing banks to hoard capital and liquidity, official says

item.title: Central African Republic launches crypto asset
item.description: Regional central bank reaffirmed ban on cryptocurrency after CAR made bitcoin legal tender

item.title: BoE’s Woods dismisses calls to weaken Solvency II reform
item.description: Deputy governor admits matching adjustment remains a “point of contention” with industry

item.title: Iran imposes restrictions on payments
item.description: Authorities cite risk of cyber attacks, but economy has also faced capital flight

item.title: Basel Committee proposes capital add-ons for crypto exposures
item.description: Committee tightens proposed rules in several areas following high-profile crypto failures

item.title: IMF warns Iceland over bank privatisation and housing market
item.description: Some bank investors have conflicts of interest and housing market is overheating – report

item.title: US senator attacks regional Fed over fintech firm’s payments access
item.description: Kansas City Fed president Esther George refuses to release correspondence about terminating account

item.title: Zimbabwe central bank negotiates lower bread prices
item.description: Russia-Ukraine war and weak currency bring misery to southern African country

item.title: Virtual asset service provider sues Fed
item.description: Crypto firm wants “master account” but critics warn of regulatory problems

item.title: Fed hiring more staff to examine cloud providers
item.description: Regulator wants to put more “boots on the ground” at firms such as Amazon, Google and Microsoft

item.title: Zimbabwe lifts lending freeze
item.description: President had announced total halt to lending in bid to defend local currency

item.title: Cuban central bank to license crypto service providers
item.description: Resolution may encourage greater use of virtual currencies for remittances

item.title: US banks anticipate delay to Basel III implementation
item.description: New Fed supervision head expected to align schedule with EU and Japan, but time is tight

item.title: BoE backs cut to insurers’ capital requirements
item.description: Post-Brexit move to ease regulations requires tightening of some other rules, central bank says

item.title: Bank of Jamaica will expand supervision of climate risks
item.description: Central bank notes island country is among 20 most vulnerable to climate change

item.title: BoE’s Woods envisages radically simplified capital regime
item.description: Prudential regulation head sketches simplified Basel III alternative

item.title: Paraguay legislative committee rejects crypto law
item.description: The central bank issued strong objections to the law, which passed the upper house in December

item.title: BoE paper finds benefits from swing pricing
item.description: Cost-benefit analysis suggests net benefit to curbing non-bank liquidity risk through swing pricing

item.title: Biden nominates Barr for Fed supervision post
item.description: Previous nominee Sarah Bloom Raskin withdrew in March after Republican attacks

item.title: MAS crypto regulatory powers extended
item.description: New bill brings virtual asset providers under AML/CFT regulation

item.title: UAE central bank to 'Emiratise' finance sector
item.description: Measure will reserve 5,000 jobs for nationals by 2026

item.title: Brazil moves forward with crypto legislation
item.description: Economic committee votes to give the central bank new regulatory powers

item.title: US regulators fine Pakistani state-owned bank
item.description: Central bank-owned NBP will pay more than $55 million for AML shortcomings

item.title: Ecuador congress removes bank regulator
item.description: Legislators charged Ruth Arregui with failure to perform duties of her office

item.title: Planned EU cross-border trading ban to hit most large markets
item.description: Most major jurisdictions currently provide either interdealer or client exemptions

item.title: Bolivian authorities implement crypto ban
item.description: Central bank will enforce 2020 measure banishing virtual assets from payments system

item.title: The longest book ever written?
item.description: The Single Rulebook on EU financial regulation is a serious contender for the prize of the longest book ever written. But will it deliver a safer and better financial system?

item.title: Kenyan central bank to oversee digital lenders
item.description: Governor had requested “teeth” from parliament but lawmakers removed some powers

item.title: China rolls out loss-absorbency rules for systemic banks
item.description: China to follow FSB standard, telling G-Sibs to build buffers worth 18% of risk-weighted assets

item.title: Quarles term as Fed vice-chair ends without replacement
item.description: Fed supervision committee will continue without a chair, acting on consensus basis

item.title: FSB to press ahead with money market fund reforms
item.description: Asset managers had argued turbulence in MMFs during Covid was symptom of stress not cause

item.title: CPMI and Iosco say systemic stablecoins must meet FMI principles
item.description: Stablecoins perform similar functions to other financial market infrastructures, say bodies

item.title: More regulatory action on big tech may be needed – FSI paper
item.description: Actions so far may not be enough to address growing risks, says Financial Stability Institute

item.title: OCC issues $250 million penalty against Wells Fargo
item.description: US regulator says bank has failed to meet commitments on loss mitigation

item.title: Carolyn Rogers hits back at critics of Basel III
item.description: BCBS secretary-general dismisses “very tired” arguments against full implementation

item.title: MAS demands crypto exchange Binance cease operations
item.description: Move came after UK’s FCA said firm failed to provide sufficient supervisory information

item.title: US regulators warn Wells Fargo of new penalties, report claims
item.description: Bloomberg says OCC and CFPB believe US bank is moving too slowly on compensating scam victims
